messages.subject: Re: Samurai & general Japanese film for November 2004
messages.msgSnippet: ... TMC/Showtime, and TCM resulted in the following films (Starz no longer offers me a genre search... do you have any idea how many channels they offer???).
messages.messageBody:
--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, spiritus saitou <spiritus_saitou@y...>
wrote:
>
> Schedule searches on IFC, Sundance Channel, HBO/Cinemax,
TMC/Showtime, and TCM resulted in the following films (Starz no
longer offers me a genre search... do you have any idea how many
channels they offer???). All times are Eastern Standard Time.
Please check your local schedule if you're interested in any of them
to be certain of showtimes.
>
>
> For more information on these films, check the Internet Movie
Database (http://www.imdb.com) or the following cable channel sites.
>
> IFC (Independent Film Channel) http://www.ifctv.com/ifc/index
> Sundance Channel http://www.sundancechannel.com
> HBO/Cinemax family
http://www.hbo.com/apps/schedule/ScheduleServlet?
ACTION_TODAY=TODAY&ntrack_para1=topnav7
> TMC/Showtime/Flix family (The Movie Channel)
http://www.sho.com/site/schedules/index.do
> TCM (Turner Classic Movies) http://www.turnerclassicmovies.com/
>
>
>
> IFC SAMURAI SATURDAYS
>
> 11/6 Sanjuro (1962) 8AM, (11/7-Sun) 6AM
>
>
>
> 11/13 Kill! (Kiru!) (1968) 8AM, (11/14-Sun) 6AM
>
>
>
> 11/20 Three Outlaw Samurai (1964) 8AM, 1:45PM, (11/21-Sun) 6AM
>
>
>
> 11/27 Samurai Spy (1965) 8AM, 2PM, (11/28-Sun) 6AM
>
>
>
> SUNDANCE CHANNEL
>
> The City of Lost Souls (a yakuza thriller, 2000)
>
> 11/8(Mon) 3:35AM, 11/12(Fri) 1:15AM, 11/15(Mon) 11:45PM, 11/27
(Sat) 3:45AM
>
>
>
> Tokyo Girls (documentary on western women as alternative to
traditional geisha, 2000)
>
> 11/8(Mon) 8PM, 11/17(Wed) 12PM, 11/20(Sat) 10:30AM, 11/26(Fri)
5:30PM, 11/27(Sat) 5:30AM, 11/29(Mon) 2:30PM
>
>
>
> Dead or Alive: Final (futuristic yakuza, 2002)
>
> 11/20(Sat) 12AM, 11/25(Thu) 2:45AM, 12/1(Wed) 12:30AM
>
>
>
> The Showtime channel "Showtime Beyond" is offering a medieval
(Heian) costume drama:
>
> Onmyoji (2001)
>
> 11/6(Sat) 8:35AM, 3:15PM, 11/10(Wed) 9:25AM, 11/14(Sun) 11AM,
11/19(Fri) 6:25AM
>
>
>
> Not Japanese, but from South Korea and of possible interest (may
contain disturbing context):
>
>
>
> The Isle (directed by Ki-duk Kim, 2000)
>
> Sundance Channel 11/5(Fri) 3:30AM, 11/13(Sat) 3:30AM, 11/23
(Tue) 1:30AM
>
>
>
> phil
>

Thanks Phil! Just thought I'd help out those who doesn't subscribe
to cable like myself... I found two of the movies Phil mentioned and
am hosting them in our streamload account.

Onmyoji and Sanjuro are there. I think I have Kiru but it must be
buried somewhere and unfortunately streamload's search function is
giving me an error. Will update if I find it.

messages.subject: Samurai & general Japanese film for November 2004
messages.msgSnippet: Schedule searches on IFC, Sundance Channel, HBO/Cinemax, TMC/Showtime, and TCM resulted in the following films (Starz no longer offers me a genre search... do
messages.messageBody:
Schedule searches on IFC, Sundance Channel, HBO/Cinemax, TMC/Showtime, and TCM resulted in the following films (Starz no longer offers me a genre search... do you have any idea how many channels they offer???). All times are Eastern Standard Time. Please check your local schedule if you're interested in any of them to be certain of showtimes.


For more information on these films, check the Internet Movie Database (http://www.imdb.com) or the following cable channel sites.

IFC (Independent Film Channel) http://www.ifctv.com/ifc/index
Sundance Channel http://www.sundancechannel.com
HBO/Cinemax family http://www.hbo.com/apps/schedule/ScheduleServlet?ACTION_TODAY=TODAY&ntrack_para1=topnav7
TMC/Showtime/Flix family (The Movie Channel) http://www.sho.com/site/schedules/index.do
TCM (Turner Classic Movies) http://www.turnerclassicmovies.com/



IFC SAMURAI SATURDAYS

11/6 Sanjuro (1962) 8AM, (11/7-Sun) 6AM



11/13 Kill! (Kiru!) (1968) 8AM, (11/14-Sun) 6AM



11/20 Three Outlaw Samurai (1964) 8AM, 1:45PM, (11/21-Sun) 6AM



11/27 Samurai Spy (1965) 8AM, 2PM, (11/28-Sun) 6AM



SUNDANCE CHANNEL

The City of Lost Souls (a yakuza thriller, 2000)

11/8(Mon) 3:35AM, 11/12(Fri) 1:15AM, 11/15(Mon) 11:45PM, 11/27(Sat) 3:45AM



Tokyo Girls (documentary on western women as alternative to traditional geisha, 2000)

11/8(Mon) 8PM, 11/17(Wed) 12PM, 11/20(Sat) 10:30AM, 11/26(Fri) 5:30PM, 11/27(Sat) 5:30AM, 11/29(Mon) 2:30PM



Dead or Alive: Final (futuristic yakuza, 2002)

11/20(Sat) 12AM, 11/25(Thu) 2:45AM, 12/1(Wed) 12:30AM



The Showtime channel �Showtime Beyond� is offering a medieval (Heian) costume drama:

Onmyoji (2001)

11/6(Sat) 8:35AM, 3:15PM, 11/10(Wed) 9:25AM, 11/14(Sun) 11AM, 11/19(Fri) 6:25AM



Not Japanese, but from South Korea and of possible interest (may contain disturbing context):



The Isle (directed by Ki-duk Kim, 2000)

Sundance Channel 11/5(Fri) 3:30AM, 11/13(Sat) 3:30AM, 11/23(Tue) 1:30AM



phil
